channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for GA
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for GA

item.title: Report X-2024100449
item.description:
Report X-2024100449

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-09T09:22:30+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-05
  • City: CONLEY
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ABF FREIGHT SYSTEM, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Kirk Smith, 086 Operations Supervisor, contacted Safety regarding a toxic liquids spill on the dock floor. Kirk Smith advised the freight being punctured by forklift operator, Julius Perrin. Kirk Smith was unable to estimate an amount spilled or the pail size due to not wanting to be near the spill. Safety advised Kirk Smith that Cura can provide the information needed. Kirk Smith advised his chest being tight due to the odor of the spill. Safety advised to contact medical attention if needed. Safety advised Kirk Smith the freight is not PIH. Reagan Cowdrey with Cura was contacted for remediat ion. Safety will update the spill report.

item.title: Report E-2024100145
item.description:
Report E-2024100145

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-05T09:31:04+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-07
  • City: ATLANTA
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 05:26 ET, XPO notified ERTS of a cargo release at terminal NAT. It was reported approximately 3 gallons of Hydrex 60240 released from a 55-gallon poly drum due to a forklift puncture. The release impacted concrete dock floor. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and determined that terminal personnel are not capable of cleaning the release with PPE available on site due to the spill containing Haz Class 8 material. Contractors used absorbents to clean concrete floor, cut up tote, PPE and absorbents were containerized to (2) 55-gallon metal drums. The waste was staged on site for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2024100144
item.description:
Report E-2024100144

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-05T09:31:04+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-06
  • City: ATLANTA
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 2316 ET, XPO notified ERTS of a cargo release at NAT. It was reported that approximately 2 gallons of Butyl Acrylate released from a 55-gallon metal drum due to a forklift puncture. The release impacted trailer #3212222 at dock door 42 and the concrete where the drum is at dock door 53. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and they felt comfortable cleaning up the release with PPE available on-site.
